class.name: Vector3i
class.brief_description: Vector used for 3D math using integer coordinates.
class.description: 3-element structure that can be used to represent positions in 3D space or any other pair of numeric values. It uses integer coordinates and is therefore preferable to [Vector3] when exact precision is required. [b]Note:[/b] In a boolean context, a Vector3i will evaluate to [code]false[/code] if it's equal to [code]Vector3i(0, 0, 0)[/code]. Otherwise, a Vector3i will always evaluate to [code]true[/code].

method.name: Vector3i
method.description: Returns a [Vector3i] with the given components.

method.name: Vector3i
method.description: Constructs a new [Vector3i] from [Vector3]. The floating point coordinates will be truncated.

method.name: max_axis
method.description: Returns the axis of the vector's largest value. See [code]AXIS_*[/code] constants. If all components are equal, this method returns [constant AXIS_X].

method.name: min_axis
method.description: Returns the axis of the vector's smallest value. See [code]AXIS_*[/code] constants. If all components are equal, this method returns [constant AXIS_Z].

method.name: sign
method.description: Returns the vector with each component set to one or negative one, depending on the signs of the components.
